intro: Hermannia scabricaulis, commonly known as the rough-stemmed hermannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its small, white or pink flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the wet season. Hermannia scabricaulis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky outcrops.
